alert.note: Alert for Eastland (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 7:21PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Eastland County through 800 PM CDT... At 721 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cross Plains, or 21 miles south of Cisco, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Eastland, Cisco, Gorman, Rising Star, Lake Cisco, Pleasant Hill, Carbon, Nimrod, Sabanno, Pioneer, Scranton and Okra. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 324 and 340. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for north central Texas.
